summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 regarding the production of documents for the case US v. Epstein. It discusses the status of copying productions 15 and 16 to hard drives, the stamping and export of documents from a Relativity database, and logistical details for shipping the drives. The correspondence is between legal or technical personnel handling evidence management.

events.title: Completion of document productions 15 & 16
events.description: An email confirms that all productions (specifically production 15 and 16) have been copied to both hard drives and are ready for shipment, marking a key milestone in evidence disclosure for the case.

events.title: Progress update on document stamping and loading
events.description: A vendor reports completing the stamping of part 5 of a production, exporting parts 1-3 from Relativity, and loading data from USAO-SDFL files into another Epstein database.

events.title: Update on production stamping progress
events.description: An email notes that part 4 of the document production is stamped, putting the process more than halfway complete, and mentions a plan to request an extension from Judge Nathan while expressing hope for earlier completion.

keyFacts: The document is part of the evidence management for US v. Epstein, specifically concerning the production and transfer of case documents onto hard drives.
Productions 15 and 16 were completed and copied to hard drives as of November 10, 2020, with passwords provided for access (EFTA00099782).
A vendor was actively stamping and exporting documents from a Relativity database, breaking the production into seven parts, with progress updates provided in early November 2020.
There was a mention of loading data from USAO-SDFL files into another Epstein database, indicating multiple databases were used for case management.
The correspondence references a planned request for an extension from Judge Nathan, suggesting timeline pressures in the document production process.
